description.value:
Three bound books are found within—the diaries of a certain W. Corbitt, a former inhabitant of the house, as the address on the flyleaf of volume one testifies.

The Corbitt Diaries are in English, though sometimes strangely phrased. The three volumes take a total of two days to read, adding +4 to Cthulhu Mythos skill and losing 1D4 Sanity points.

The diaries describe Corbitt’s various occult experiments, including the summoning of some unearthly spirit and other magic, and clearly describe a spell entitled “Call Forth the Opener of Ways”.The spell takes 2D6 weeks to learn after the diaries have been read.

spells.name: Call Forth the Opener of Ways

system.castingTime: 5 minutes per magic point spent, binding takes 1 round.

costs.others: 1 magic point per 10% chance of success
